alert.note: Alert for Blaine; Caddo; Canadian; Custer; Dewey; Ellis; Kingfisher; Logan; Oklahoma; Roger Mills (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 09 at 1:43AM CDT by NWS Norman-Oklahoma City
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Kingfisher, southeastern Ellis, northwestern Caddo, northern Oklahoma, northeastern Roger Mills, Custer, Blaine, southwestern Logan, southern Dewey and Canadian Counties through 215 AM CDT... At 143 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 4 miles southwest of Lovell to near Fay to 5 miles northwest of Angora. Movement was southeast at 45 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Northern Oklahoma City, Edmond, El Reno, Weatherford, Guthrie, Clinton, Watonga, Kingfisher, Yukon, The Village, Piedmont, Hinton, Hennessey, Crescent, Geary, Luther, Okarche, Thomas, Hydro, and Cashion. This includes the following highways... Interstate 35 between mile markers 139 and 155. Interstate 40 between mile markers 64 and 124. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. These storms may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.

area.areaDesc: Blaine; Caddo; Canadian; Custer; Dewey; Ellis; Kingfisher; Logan; Oklahoma; Roger Mills
